Coinbase Vs SEC: XRP Lawyer Rates Chances Of Case Dismissal At 35%, Here‚Äôs Why
entry.summary:
Popular pro-XRP lawyer John E. Deaton has weighed in on the ongoing court case between the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the Coinbase cryptocurrency exchange.
In June, the US securities regulator launched a lawsuit against Coinbase, accusing the exchange of running an ‚Äúunregistered securities exchange, broker and clearing agency.‚Äù
On August 4, Coinbase responded to these charges with a motion to dismiss. The defendants claimed their exchange offered no securities and thus does not operate under the SEC‚Äôs jurisdiction.¬†
Deaton Raises Coinbase‚Äôs Chances Of Motion Dismissal Following Uniswap‚Äôs Victory
According to an X post on August 30, John Deaton had stated there is a 35% chance that Coinbase‚Äôs motion to dismiss the SEC‚Äôs case gains the court‚Äôs favor ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Binance to Gradually Phase Out Support for BUSD Stablecoin
entry.summary:
The world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency exchange by global trade volume, Binance, has announced it is discontinuing support for the stablecoin asset BUSD. The trading platform is encouraging users to swap their BUSD as Binance gradually phases out BUSD markets.
BUSD Support Ending on Binance, Users Told to Swap Tokens
On August 31, Binance disclosed BUSD support will be phased out and the exchange is asking users to convert BUSD to other stablecoins before February 2024. The blog post notes the issuer of BUSD, Paxos, has halted minting the stablecoin and Binance is offering no-fee swaps if customers convert BUSD balances into FDUSD.
On Sept. 7, Binance will suspend BUSD loans on cross margins and on Oct. 19, cross-margin and portfolio margin users will no longer be able to transfer additional BUSD as new collateral to the platform‚Äôs cross-margin wallet. ‚ÄúWithdrawals of Binance-Peg BUSD tokens via BNB Chain, Avalanche, Polygon, Tron, and Optimism networks will cease [on September 7],‚Äù the exchange disclosed.
Other suspension announcements say support will continue ‚Äúuntil further announcements.‚Äù Several other phase-out BUSD dates are listed for Binance‚Äôs loan and earn programs. BUSD has seen its supply gradually decline since Paxos was told by U.S. regulators it could no longer mint BUSD.
The stablecoin‚Äôs market valuation is just above the $3 billion range, while there‚Äôs 327 million FDUSD in circulation today. Binance‚Äôs announcement notes that while BUSD is being discontinued, the exchange assures that ‚ÄúBUSD will always be backed 1:1 by USD.‚Äù
Meanwhile, Binance commands a majority of the TUSD supply according to Nansen analytics which shows the exchange‚Äôs TUSD stash represents more than 5% of its reserves. Binance further controls more than $17 billion worth of tether (USDT).
What do you think about Binance ending support for BUSD? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

entry.title: Can Bitcoin Continue Rally? Rising Volume May Hint So
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows the Bitcoin trading volume has been increasing recently, which could help further the asset‚Äôs rally.
Bitcoin Trading Volume Has Registered A Large Boost Recently
According to data from the on-chain analytics firm Santiment, BTC continues to see high volumes. The ‚Äútrading volume‚Äù here refers to measuring the daily total amount of a specific asset being moved around on the blockchain.
When the value of this metric is high, it means that many tokens of the cryptocurrency in question are currently observing some movement. Such a trend implies that traders are active in the market right now.
On the other hand, low values of the indicator suggest the network is going through a period of low activity, a possible sign that the general interest in the coin among investor‚Ä¶

entry.title: Coinbase Debuts Paypal‚Äôs PYUSD Stablecoin; Trading to Roll Out in Phases Pending Liquidity
entry.summary:
Coinbase has listed Paypal‚Äôs PYUSD stablecoin, following an announcement of its support for the digital asset just a day earlier. Should liquidity requirements be satisfied, the exchange plans to introduce trading pairs for the asset in stages.
Coinbase Adds PYUSD Stablecoin
Coinbase, the prominent cryptocurrency exchange headquartered in San Francisco, has incorporated Paypal‚Äôs dollar-tied token, PYUSD, into its offerings. The firm broke the news on Wednesday, mentioning that trading would commence at 9 a.m. PT on Thursday, provided ‚Äúliquidity conditions were met.‚Äù
‚ÄúOnce sufficient supply of this asset is established trading on our PYUSD-USD trading pairs will launch in phases,‚Äù elaborated Coinbase. ‚ÄúSupport for PYUSD may be restricted in some supported jurisdictions.‚Äù The exchange also emphasized that PYUSD operates as an ERC20 token on the Ethereum network, cautioning users against transferring the asset through alternate networks to avoid potential losses.
According to a recent Bitcoin.com News report, PYUSD‚Äôs supply experienced a spike leaping from 26.9 million to 43.3 million PYUSD. However, despite the recent addition to Coinbase, PYUSD‚Äôs activity remains limited, recording merely 1,587 transfers and boasting 388 holders. As of 12:30 p.m. ET on August 31, the exchange‚Äôs web portal says PYUSD can be acquired via Coinbase.
Our report on PYUSD highlighted that other digital currency platforms, such as Crypto.com, Uniswap, Gate.io, Bitmart, and Bybit, also support the token. On Thursday specifically, a labeled Coinbase wallet possesses around 1,005,467 PYUSD, ranking it as the fifth-largest PYUSD wallet as of August 31. This means the Coinbase wallet accounts for approximately 2.3221% of the total supply of Paypal‚Äôs stablecoin token.
What do you think about Coinbase listing Paypal‚Äôs PYUSD? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

entry.title: US Court Defies SEC Interpretation Of Crypto, XRP Lawyer Weighs In
entry.summary:
Regulators are still figuring out how to oversee crypto, but some recent judicial rulings show promise for the industry‚Äôs legal battles with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
Bill Morgan, an attorney representing Ripple in its protracted legal battle with the¬†SEC, has been vocal about the evolving judicial stance on crypto. His recent¬†comments underline a changing tide in the interpretation of digital assets and a seeming divergence from the SEC‚Äôs traditionally stringent perspective.
Judge‚Äôs Affirmation Of BTC And ETH As Commodities
In the thick of several lawsuits against crypto firms, the courts have shown a trend of¬†contradicting the SEC‚Äôs assertions. An instance of this is Judge Katherine Polk¬†Failla‚Äôs recent ruling.
The decentralized exchange, Uniswap Labs, w‚Ä¶

entry.title: Chainalysis, The Theranos Of Blockchain Forensics?
entry.summary: After Chainalysis Head of Investigations Elizabeth Bisbee had to admit to the lack of scientific evidence for the accuracy of Chainalysis‚Äô Reactor software, experts of blockchain surveillance firm CipherTrace lay bare flaws in Chainalysis‚Äô analysis. An expert report filed on August 8th in the case United States vs. Sterlingov reveals a range of mistakes in Bisbee‚Äôs expert report as well as inaccuracies in the heuristics applied by Chainalysis‚Äô Reactor software. Chainalysis Reactor is a blockchain surveillance tool used to trace funds on the blockchain for law enforcement purposes. The widespread use of Chainalysis‚Äô Reactor could pose a serious threat to democratic justice proceedings if the software‚Äôs findings prove to be unsubstantiated. Roman Sterlingov is an early Bitcoin adopter accu‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner Iris Energy Dives into Generative AI, Investing $10M in Nvidia GPUs Amidst Soaring Demand
entry.summary:
On August 29, the publicly traded bitcoin mining entity, Iris Energy, revealed its acquisition of 248 Nvidia H100 graphics processing units (GPUs) at a cost of $10 million. While the company emphasized that its primary focus remains on BTC mining, it views generative artificial intelligence (AI) as an enticing ‚Äúadditional opportunity.‚Äù
From Bitcoin Mining ASICs to Nvidia GPUs ‚Äî Iris Energy Expands to Offer AI Services
As generative AI gained momentum in the early 2020s, tech giants such as Microsoft, Google and Baidu ramped up their investments. However, by 2023, the technology saw an even more pronounced surge.
Generative AI involves artificial intelligence (AI) systems that create new content ‚Äî be it text, images or video ‚Äî grounded in their training data. Openai‚Äôs Chatgpt, Anthrop‚Ä¶

entry.title: SWIFT Embraces Crypto: Integration With Chainlink (LINK) A Success?
entry.summary:
The Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunications (SWIFT) announced a success with its integration with Chainlink (LINK). The international entity has been experimenting with blockchain technology, both private and public networks, and finally revealed the progress of its efforts.
Chainlink To Improve International Payment Rails?
Per an official statement, SWIFT claims that its infrastructure can ‚Äúseamlessly‚Äù integrate with blockchain technology to enable users to transfer ‚Äútokenized value‚Äù across multiple networks. In that way, the international monetary system aims to reduce friction from these transfers and allow the tokenized asset markets to ‚Äúscale globally.‚Äù
A tokenized asset is a ‚Äúreal-world‚Äù asset, such as a stock, property, or commodity, whose value is linke‚Ä¶

entry.title: This Nigerian Crypto Exchange Valued At $50 Million Is Raising Suspicions, Here‚Äôs Why
entry.summary:
Nigerian crypto exchange Patricia has raised suspicions following its newly launched Patricia Stablecoin labeled PTK and its unilateral decision to convert users‚Äô funds to its stablecoin without its users‚Äô consent.
Patricia‚Äôs Dubious Move
In May 2023, the Nigerian exchange Patricia reportedly fell victim to a hack and reportedly lost close to $2 million. During this period, clients and users faced a lot of difficulties gaining access to their funds as Patricia froze all withdrawals in its platform and provided a statement to assure its worried users about the situation of their funds.
However, Patricia users were still able to withdraw their funds via the crypto exchange‚Äôs newly launched app known as Patricia Plus App, but only a few withdrawals were processed as the platform could‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Magazine Inscribes Cover of Latest Print Issue As Recursive Ordinal
entry.summary: Bitcoin Magazine has just launched its latest Ordinal inscription, honoring the new tradition of publishing the print edition covers directly to the Bitcoin blockchain. This time, the company inscribed both the front and back cover of the magazine, as the ‚ÄúWithdrawal Issue‚Äù shows a unique full-spread design, complete with the spine. Differently from previous launches, Bitcoin Magazine‚Äôs Q3 print magazine cover was inscribed leveraging state-of-the-art recursion technology, which has become popular with users of the Ordinals protocol. Recursion works by allowing an inscription to reference other inscriptions previously added to Bitcoin. Many different use cases can arise from such an arrangement, and in this case the goal was to achieve print-quality digital image, while lowering the storag‚Ä¶

entry.title: Biggest Movers: DOGE Remains Near 2-Week High, SOL Nears Move Below $20
entry.summary:
Dogecoin stayed close to a two-week high on Thursday, as markets rebounded from a slight sell-off during yesterday‚Äôs session. Traders moved to secure profits over the last 24 hours, following strong gains on Tuesday. Solana neared a drop below $20.
Dogecoin (DOGE)
Dogecoin (DOGE) remained close to a multi-week high during today‚Äôs session, as bulls attempted to maintain recent pressure.
After sliding to a low of $0.06468 on Wednesday, DOGE/USD moved to a peak of $0.06692 earlier today.
This was marginally below Tuesday‚Äôs high of $0.0687, which is the strongest level the meme coin had hit since mid-August.
Bullish momentum has eased in recent days since the relative strength index (RSI) collided with a resistance level of 48.00.
Price strength has since tailed off, and at the time of writing this is now tracking at the 45.92 mark.
Should a break out of the aforementioned ceiling take place in the coming days, bulls will likely attempt to take the price above $0.0700.
Solana (SOL)
On the other hand, solana (SOL) extended a recent losing streak on Thursday, with the price moving closer to a drop below $20.00.
SOL/USD bottomed out at $20.55 earlier in today‚Äôs session, which comes following a high of $21.01 the day prior.
The recent shift in sentiment comes as solana bulls were unable to orchestrate a move beyond a resistance level of $22.
It now seems inevitable that the token will fall to a floor at $20, depending on where the RSI lands.
As of writing this, the index is at a reading of 41.73, with a support point of 39.00 a possible target for sellers.
Solana could drop under the $20.00 level in the not-too-distant future, in the event this floor is hit.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Will solana start September below $20.00? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Introducing ColLabs: A Web3 Investment Community by Binance Labs
entry.summary:
Binance Labs, the venture capital and incubation arm of Binance, is committed to helping Web3 startups achieve success by closing the gap between mentorship and funding. They do this by leveraging technical know-how from the Binance ecosystem and offering incubation programs to early-stage startups. Recognizing that the strength of the Web3 industry lies in its community, Binance Labs has announced ColLabs by Binance Labs, an invite-only Web3 investment and financing community for founders, builders, and investors.
ColLabs by Binance Labs aims to foster connections within the Web3 venture capital (VC) community and serve as a knowledge exchange hub. The community is designed to facilitate the sharing of insights and investment opportunities sourced from the Binance Labs team and our port‚Ä¶

entry.title: Uphold Inks Sleeve Sponsorship Deal with Premier League Club Burnley
entry.summary:
As the English Premier League (EPL) season kicks off, the US-based digital trading platform Uphold has entered into a sleeve sponsorship deal with Burnley FC. Uphold‚Äôs logo will appear on the left sleeves of Burnley‚Äôs shirts for the 2023-24 season, according to a statement published on the club's website. This move reportedly positions the digital trading platform to gain substantial brand exposure through LED advertising boards surrounding Turf Moor, the club‚Äôs football stadium, as well as across Burnley‚Äôs social channels and media backdrops. The UK-based football club has more than 800,000 followers on X (formerly Twitter).

entry.title: Crypto a 'No-Brainer' for Video Games, Says Mino Games CEO
entry.summary: Mino Games CEO Sasha MacKinnon, developer of the upcoming Dimensionals game, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the studio's approach to digital collectibles.

entry.title: Michael Wagner's 'Controversial Take' on Crypto in Games
entry.summary: At Solana's PlayGG, Star Atlas CEO Michael Wagner shares his "controversial take" on crypto in games, shares the challenges of developing the upcoming scifi game, and how crypto's volatility has changed his perspective with Decrypt's Jason Nelson.

entry.title: Interview: Angelic CEO on Building the Sci-Fi RPG on Solana and Ethereum
entry.summary: Angelic is a sci-fi roleplay game in development that will be free-to-play and offer optional, opt-in crypto features on Solana and Ethereum and a governance token. Metaverse Game Studios CEO and Founder Erkan Bayol tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he sees AAA traditional games as Angelic's main competitors and shares his vision for the game.

entry.title: Apex Legends Voice Actor on AI's Impact on Video Games
entry.summary: Ben Prendergast is an actor who has voiced characters like Apex Legends' Fuse, God of War Ragnarok's Tyr, and Patroclus in Hades. But as debates swirl around the use of artificial intelligence in entertainment in light of the SAG-AFTRA and WGA strikes, Prendergast gives Decrypt's Kate Irwin his honest take on the potential use of AI actors in games.

entry.title: Star Atlas CEO on Developing an MMO Game
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson speaks with Star Atlas Founder and CEO Michael Wagner about the MMO game's approach to development, marketing, and blockchain integrations.

entry.title: Aurory's Origin Story: How JRPGs Inspired the Games
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson talks to Aurory's Head of Marketing and Business Development Michael Natoli about the origins of the Aurory crypto games at the Solana PlayGG event.

entry.title: Parallel TCG: Inside the Sci-Fi Card Game‚Äôs Closed Beta
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes hands-on with Parallel‚Äôs closed beta on Windows PC to find out what sets it apart from other crypto card-battlers.

entry.title: Web3 Games Need to Compete with All Games, Says Solana Foundation GM
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's General Manager of Games Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about Solana's PlayGG conference and shares his take on crypto gaming and the "play-to-earn" concept.

entry.title: Many Early Blockchain Games Were 'Cash Grabs,' Says Twitch Streamer Alliestrasza
entry.summary: "I wrote them off," Twitch streamer Alliestrasza said of her initial thoughts on many early blockchain games. She tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how her perspective on Web3 games has evolved over time and now sees blockchain games getting significantly better.

entry.title: 'MetalCore' Game Preview: Hands-on With the 'Titanfall' Meets 'Destiny' NFT Mashup
entry.summary: MetalCore is an upcoming mech shooter developed by Studio 369, and it's being developed on Ethereum scaling network Immutable zkEVM. Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin played through the prologue and tested out the recent Alpha 3 online experience to get a sense of the NFT-infused mashup of Titanfall and Destiny.

entry.title: 'Give Projects a Chance,' Says Aurory's Michael Natoli on NFT Game Challenges
entry.summary: Aurory is an NFT-driven game franchise that started life on Solana and is expanding to other chains. Decrypt's Jason Nelson spoke with Aurory Head of Marketing Michael Natoli at Solana's PlayGG event, where Natoli shared his thoughts on the challenges that blockchain games face in reaching players.
